qas.question: What is the previous name of Tuvalu?
In which ocean is Tuvalu found?
Between what land areas is Tuvalu located?
According the the 2012 census, how many people live on the Tuvalu islands?
What originally formed the Tuvalu islands?

context: Tuvalu (i/tuːˈvɑːluː/ too-VAH-loo or /ˈtuːvəluː/ TOO-və-loo), formerly known as the <a0_0>Ellice Islands<a0_0/>, is a Polynesian island nation located in the <a1_0>Pacific Ocean<a1_0/>, midway between <a2_0>Hawaii and Australia<a2_0/>. It comprises three <a4_0>reef<a4_0/> islands and six true atolls spread out between the latitude of 5° to 10° south and longitude of 176° to 180°, west of the International Date Line. Its nearest neighbours are Kiribati, Nauru, Samoa and Fiji. Tuvalu has a population of <a3_0>10,640<a3_0/> (2012 census). The total land area of the islands of Tuvalu is 26 square kilometres (10 sq mi).
